section: 1.1 All defined terms In this Agreement not otherwise defined in this Section shall have the meanings assigned in the part of this Agreement in which they are defined.
explanation: This definition is structurally flawed because it's self-referential. It states that defined terms not defined in Section 1.0 shall have meanings assigned elsewhere in the agreement, but it doesn't provide any direction for terms not defined anywhere in the agreement. This creates a circular dependency and doesn't clarify what happens if a term is used but never actually defined.

section: 4.1 This Agreement shall apply and remain in effect from the Effective Date and perpetually thereafter unless terminated pursuant to the Section entitled Termination.
explanation: This is a contradiction because it states the agreement is perpetual, but it can be terminated.

section: 16.4 Bank of America shall pay Supplier for all services and applicable taxes invoiced In arrears in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, within sixty (60) calendar days of the date of receipt of a valid and correct invoice by Bank of America. Bank of America reserves the right to pay prior to the expiration of the sixty (60) day period. If Bank of America pays within thirty (30) calendar days of receipt of a valid invoice by Bank of America, a discount of two percent (2%) will be subtracted from the total invoice amount for Services.
explanation: The language is ambiguous because it's not clear if the 2% discount applies only to 'services' or to the entire invoice amount, which could include taxes and other charges. This could lead to disputes over the correct amount to be paid when the early payment discount is taken.
